name: FortiSOAR Health Assessment > Report Generation
description: This playbook generates the report that is attached to Health Assessment Module

arguments.most_time_consuming: {% for data in vars.input.params['fortisoar_health_data']['fortisoar_information']['top_10_most_time_consuming_playbooks'] %} {{loop.index}} {{data.playbook_name}} {% set timestamp = data['time_consumed'] %}{% set time_parts = timestamp.split('.') %}{% set time = time_parts[0] %}{% set milliseconds = time_parts[1] if time_parts|length > 1 else '' %}{% set hours, minutes, seconds = time.split(':') %}{% set time_string = (hours | string) + ' hr, ' if hours | int > 0 else '' %}{% set time_string = time_string+(minutes | string) + ' min, ' if minutes | int > 0 else '' %}{% set time_string = time_string+(seconds | string) + ' sec, ' if seconds | int > 0 else '' %}{% set time_string = time_string+ (milliseconds | string) + ' ms. ' if milliseconds | int > 0 else '' %}{{time_string}} {% endfor%}

params.name: {{vars.steps.Create_Report_File.data.filename| regex_replace("_[0-9]+[\.]html", "") | regex_replace("_"," ")}} Report
params.description: This is Playbook Generated Report by FortiSOAR Health Assessment

arguments.report_code:
FortiSOAR Health Assessment

Here are Your System Details
{{vars.current_system_configuration}}

Current System State

Playbook : Most Time Consuming

{{vars.most_time_consuming if vars.most_time_consuming else vars.playbook_no_data}}
Sr. No. Playbook Name Time Consumed

We recommend following system configuration based on system information gathered

Recommendation for Workflow Engine, Swap Space and php-fpm

{{vars.celeryd_html}} {{vars.sealab_wsgi_html}} {{vars.integrations_wgsi_html}} {{vars.php_fpm_html}} {{vars.rabbit_mq_html}} {{vars.swap_space_html}}
Sr. No. Configuration Recommendations Current Value

Recommendation for PostgreSQL

{{vars.postgresql_html}}
Sr. No. Property Recommendations Current Value

Here is the way to use this configuration and apply in your VM

Steps to incorporate the above listed recommendation

  1. Login to Terminal of Your VM via SSH
  2. Following are the ways to implement above configuration
    • Using CLI command : Run following command to apply latest configuration recommeded in Health Assessment record
      • Command : sudo csadm system config --mode optimal
    • Manually : Edit following files with above mentioned changes
      • celeryd
        • File Location : /etc/celery/celeryd.conf
      • sealab_wsgi
        • File Location : /etc/uwsgi.d/sealab_wsgi.ini
      • integrations_wsgi
        • File Location : /etc/uwsgi.d/integrations_wsgi.ini
      • PHP-FPM
        • File Location : /etc/php-fpm.d/cyops-api.conf
      • RabbitMQ
        • File Location : /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf
      • PostgreSQL
        • File Location : /var/lib/pgsql/16/data/postgresql.conf
  3. Swap Space
    • Use the documentation for creating swap space
  4. Restart services using csadm commands csadm services --restart

arguments.alert_no_data: No Data Available
arguments.playbook_no_data: No Data Available

arguments.celeryd_html: 1 File - /etc/celery/celeryd.conf Update key CELERYD_OPTS to use value = "{{vars.celeryd}}" {{vars.current_celeryd}}
arguments.php_fpm_html:
4 File - /etc/php-fpm.d/cyops-api.conf Update value of pm.max_children to {{vars.php_fpm["pm.max_children"]}}, pm.start_servers to {{vars.php_fpm["pm.start_servers"]}} and of pm.max_spare_servers to {{vars.php_fpm["pm.max_spare_servers"]}},
e.g pm.max_children = {{vars.php_fpm["pm.max_children"]}}, pm.start_servers = {{vars.php_fpm["pm.start_servers"]}}, pm.max_spare_servers = {{vars.php_fpm["pm.max_spare_servers"]}} pm.max_children = {{vars.current_php_fpm["pm.max_children"]}},
pm.start_servers = {{vars.current_php_fpm["pm.start_servers"]}},
pm.max_spare_servers = {{vars.current_php_fpm["pm.max_spare_servers"]}}
arguments.rabbit_mq_html: 5 File - /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf Update value of RABBITMQ_SERVER_ADDITIONAL_ERL_ARGS to "{{vars.rabbit_mq}}" {{vars.current_rabbit_mq}}
arguments.postgresql_html: 1 work_mem {{vars.postgresql["work_mem"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["work_mem"]}} 2 wal_buffers {{vars.postgresql["wal_buffers"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["wal_buffers"]}} 3 max_wal_size {{vars.postgresql["max_wal_size"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["max_wal_size"]}} 4 min_wal_size {{vars.postgresql["min_wal_size"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["min_wal_size"]}} 5 shared_buffers {{vars.postgresql["shared_buffers"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["shared_buffers"]}} 6 max_connections {{vars.postgresql["max_connections"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["max_connections"]}} 7 random_page_cost {{vars.postgresql["random_page_cost"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["random_page_cost"]}} 8 effective_cache_size {{vars.postgresql["effective_cache_size"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["effective_cache_size"]}} 9 maintenance_work_mem {{vars.postgresql["maintenance_work_mem"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["maintenance_work_mem"]}} 10 max_parallel_workers {{vars.postgresql["max_parallel_workers"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["max_parallel_workers"]}} 11 max_worker_processes {{vars.postgresql["max_worker_processes"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["max_worker_processes"]}} 12 effective_io_concurrency {{vars.postgresql["effective_io_concurrency"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["effective_io_concurrency"]}} 13 checkpoint_completion_target {{vars.postgresql["checkpoint_completion_target"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["checkpoint_completion_target"]}} 14 max_parallel_workers_per_gather {{vars.postgresql["max_parallel_workers_per_gather"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["max_parallel_workers_per_gather"]}} 15 max_parallel_maintenance_workers {{vars.postgresql["max_parallel_maintenance_workers"]}} {{vars.current_postgresql["max_parallel_maintenance_workers"]}}
arguments.swap_space_html: 6 Use the documentation for creating swap space {{vars.swap_space}} {{vars.current_swap_space}}
arguments.sealab_wsgi_html: 2 File - /etc/uwsgi.d/sealab_wsgi.ini Update value of processes to 6 , e.g processes = {{vars.sealab_wsgi}} {{vars.current_sealab_wsgi}}
arguments.integrations_wgsi_html: 3 File - /etc/uwsgi.d/integrations_wgsi.ini Update value of processes to 6 , e.g processes = {{vars.integrations_wgsi}} {{vars.current_integrations_wgsi}}
